text: Submit to Aglaea's interrogation â€” it's better to speak the truth

title: Mission Description
content: Aglaea's control overOkhemaruns far deeper than we anticipated, and the previous incident has already reached her ears. This leader of the Chrysos Heirs revealed a cold and unyielding side, going to great lengths to reassess our intentions. After such perilous moments, we must reconsider the viability of our expedition inAmphoreus.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...What is the meaning of this?

text: Why is this happening again?
We've been made...
As expected.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is no laughing matter. It's an interrogation.

speaker: Aglaea
line: While the both of you were roaming the city, someone was paying attention to your every move. Unfortunately... you have broken your promises.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So, you are indeed aware of our transgression... However, we only did so to save a life.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The holy city's fate is as fragile as thread. I must exercise prudence in order to eliminate sources of potential disaster.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I will grant the both of you another chance to mend our broken trust. The golden thread shall judge on my behalf. If you're truthful, you will live, else... you will perish.

speaker: Castorice
line: We meet again, distinguished guests.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Castorice will be your executioner.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Lady Aglaea, it is undeniable that we broke our agreement out of carelessness. However, you never explained to us how revealing that a world beyond the sky exists would lead to dire consequences.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What I want to know is, exactly how grave a crime have we committed?

speaker: Aglaea
line: A reasonable request. It is indeed my oversight for failing to tell you everything in time.

speaker: Aglaea
line: There have always been people in Amphoreus who looked beyond the skies. Indeed, there used to be a usurper nation that spared no expense in constructing "skyships," with the desire to break through the blue sky and reach the stars...

speaker: Aglaea
line: However, Aquila 's divine punishment fell the instant the fleet of skyships took flight. An entire city-state, along with all of its subjects, was reduced to ash in that moment.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's not that Amphoreus is unwilling to head toward the stars. Yet, anyone who even thinks about breaching the firmament would undoubtedly infuriate the gods, causing this land of the living to burn and an entire nation of mortals to perish. The Eye of Twilight is only one example of this.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is forbidden territory which can never be ventured into.

text: So you're saying that it's better to pretend it doesn't exist instead?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Humanity has always longed for the sky... and this is something that you can't prevent.

text: We mean no harm toward Amphoreus...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Divine punishment has never been fair. As Okhema's guardian, I must do the same.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is a world dominated by Titans. And that order can only be toppled by the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Therefore, the only thing that I can do right now is to ensure that the both of you remain... devoted.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Three steps, Castorice.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Yes, Lady Aglaea.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I shall ask you four questions. Dishonest answers will cause the golden thread to vibrate, while truthful responses will not affect the thread.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The number of times that the thread trembles... is the number of steps forward that the executioner will take.

speaker: Aglaea
line: If she isn't standing behind you after all four questions have been asked and answered, the both of you will have passed this test. If she is... your journey will end here.

speaker: Castorice
line: You'll fall asleep amid the warm embrace of flowers and feel no pain... That I can guarantee.

text: There's no need for such guarantees!
Does this mean that we can lie up to two times?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: If you treat your lives as mere trifles, then you may do as you wish.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: â–¶ Regardless of what she says, ( Trailblazer ), we'll be fine as long as our consciences are clear.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Well then, let us begin. Question One.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Outlanders, why have you come to Amphoreus?

text: To solve the problems plaguing this world.

children.text: The golden thread trembles slightly.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: A half-truth that still conceals some facts. Yet, the rules leave no room for compromise. A step will be recorded.

text: To allow our journey to continue.

children.text: The golden thread remains calm and unchanged.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: A truthful response. A step will not be recorded.

text: To turn this place upside down!

children.text: The golden thread trembles violently.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Jokes cannot conceal your true intentions. Opportunities are fleeting and you've just wasted one.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Question Two.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Outlanders, why did you lend your aid to Okhema?

text: Because of our courageous spirit and selfless hearts!

children.text: The golden thread trembles slightly.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: A response that is certainly full of spirit, but lacking in sincerity... A step will be recorded.

text: I regret what we did. We shouldn't have aided Okhema at all!

children.text: The golden thread trembles violently.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You've let your anger consume you. A step will be recorded.

text: To allow our journey to continue.

children.text: The golden thread remains calm and unchanged.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: No fluctuations detected. A step will not be recorded.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Question Three.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Outlanders, if the current situation changed dramatically, could you eventually point your blades at Okhema and its citizens?

text: I... can't make any guarantees.

children.text: The golden thread remains calm and unchanged.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: A response that lacks embellishment. You have no misgivings about the friction or suspicion that your answer might cause. A step will not be recorded.

text: Not a chance!

children.text: The golden thread trembles slightly.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Although you attempted to make a promise, your resolve didn't match your response... A step will be recorded.

text: I use a baseball bat, not a blade.

children.text: The golden thread trembles violently.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Trying to hasten your demise by being glib with your response? I can certainly satisfy your desire. A step will be recorded.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Final Question.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Outlander, an unknown but surging power exists within your body... Are you willing to use it to aid the Chrysos Heirs in slaying the gods?

text: Wait, you can even detect that?

children.text: The golden thread trembles violently.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Response to a question with another question indicates intense suspicion and resistance... A step will be recorded.

text: I am not willing, and I cannot agree to your request.

children.text: The golden thread remains calm and unchanged.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Such determination... It makes me wonder what secrets are hidden within you. A step will not be recorded.

text: It's one of the Destruction 's seeds of disaster . Be careful, it might backfire.

children.text: The golden thread trembles slightly.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: An angry threat... but one laced with uncertainty. You don't understand the power within your body either. A step will not be recorded this time.

text: (If at least two questions were answered truthfully)

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: All four questions have been asked and answered.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You have earned a second chance with your honesty.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Both of you may continue to stay in Okhema, and its citizens will continue to view you as distinguished guests. However, you must promise that today's farce will not occur again.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I think it's more appropriate for us to say that last part.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You seriously still expect us to help you after what we just went through?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Regardless of your choice, the Chrysos Heirs will continue to follow the path in the prophecy.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: You may be a ray of hope that fell onto Amphoreus. However, until all has been proven, you cannot be allowed to pose a threat to Amphoreus.

children.text: If we stay, will you continue to monitor us?
Are all Chrysos Heirs as paranoid as you?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: For the holy city, I am willing to bear all the traits that others despise and use every heartless yet effective trick in the book.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Forgive us, but I'm afraid our cooperation cannot continue under these conditions.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: If we cannot gain people's â€” no, if we cannot gain your trust, Lady Aglaea â€” we'll depart. Amphoreus isn't the only option for the Nameless .

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Things don't have to end on a sour note between us.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...I respect your decision.
Hold on! Please wait a moment...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...Phainon?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Aglaea, as the first person to encounter them... I have some thoughts I would like to share regarding whether they can stay.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Do speak your mind.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: When I first met them in the Abyss, I was wary of them as well and never let my guard down throughout our journey back to the holy city.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: However, during the battle to defend Okhema, we fought side by side numerous times. The look in someone's eyes in moments of life-and-death never lies, and I was able to detect the conviction in their eyes back then. That's why I was willing to put my life in their hands.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Please believe a warrior's intuition.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: At present, Okhema is desperate for aid, and I am loath to lose two allies just like that.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Isn't this what Miss Castorice believes as well?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...Yeah.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I'm more willing to view "death" as a peaceful farewell than a punishment.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: So, two Chrysos Heirs are willing to vouch for you. Hah... It seems my actions were too high-handed.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Phainon, will you fulfill your duty as host and look after our distinguished guests?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: While I'm not good at formalities, I'll do my best.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Cas... Next time, I hope you will express your thoughts openly.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I will.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Now, it's time to welcome the newcomers to the Vortex of Genesis. As you both have chosen to trust these outlanders, ensure they are adequately informed about the mysteries concealed within.

text: (If at least 3 questions were not answered truthfully)

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: All four questions have been asked and answered.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: The golden thread has exposed your hesitations. Regrettably, the both of you have failed the test.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: While you may be a ray of hope that fell onto Amphoreus, you may also be... a threat to Amphoreus. You leave me no choice but to shut the doors of your fates.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Determining our fates with extrajudicial execution... How unreasonable.

children.text: Talk about burning bridges! After all we've done to help you.
Justice, fairness, impartiality, where art thou?
Someone, anyone, save us...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I don't think anybody will be able to hear our cries... given where we are right now.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: For the holy city, I am willing to bear all the traits that others despise and use every heartless yet effective trick in the book.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Castorice, please give our guests a merciful farewell.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Don't be nervous...

children.text: Dâ€”Don't come near me...
Wait! Please, just give me one more chance...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Please... relax.

children.text: Castorice places her slender, pale finger over your pulse.
A chill seeps through your skin, then immediately spreads into your veins.
Castorice adds a second finger... then a third, until half her palm gently envelops your left wrist.
A subtle fragrance of an unnamed flower fills your senses, its sweetness making you forget the need to breathe.
Your vision blurs, and cold reality fades into a purple ocean â€” her promised land of flowers.
Then, you finally understand...
...you are currently welcoming your own sweet demise.

children.line: ...Wait! This story can't end just like that.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...Phainon?

children.text: I'm still alive.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You bet you are.

children.text: I've been reborn on Amphoreus?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Not quite, Friend. You're still alive and kicking.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You've been on Amphoreus for such a short time. Even someone as ruthless as Thanatos wouldn't end a journey so hurriedly.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Aglaea, as the first local to encounter them... I have some thoughts I would like to share regarding their fates.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Do speak your mind.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: When I first met them in the Abyss, I was wary of them as well and never let my guard down throughout our journey back to the holy city.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: However, during the battle to defend Okhema, we fought side by side numerous times. The look in someone's eyes in moments of life-and-death never lies, and I was able to detect the conviction in their eyes back then. That's why I was willing to put my life in their hands.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Please believe a warrior's intuition.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: At present, Okhema is desperate for aid, and I am loath to lose two allies just like that.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Isn't this what Miss Castorice believes as well?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...Yeah.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I'm more willing to view "death" as a peaceful farewell than a punishment.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...I see.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: So, two Chrysos Heirs are willing to vouch for you. Hah... It seems my actions were too high-handed.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Phainon, will you fulfill your duty as host and look after our distinguished guests?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: While I'm not good at formalities, I'll do my best.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Cas... Next time, I hope you will express your thoughts openly.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I will.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Now, it's time to welcome the newcomers to the Vortex of Genesis. As you both have chosen to trust these outlanders, ensure they are adequately informed about the mysteries concealed within.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Hold on, you seriously still expect us to help you after what we just went through?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Forgive us, but I'm afraid our cooperation cannot continue under these conditions. If we cannot gain people's â€” no, if we cannot gain your trust, Lady Aglaea â€” we'll depart. Amphoreus isn't the only option for the Nameless.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Things don't have to end on a sour note between us.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Regardless of your choice, the Chrysos Heirs will continue to follow the path in the prophecy.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Phainon's words have convinced me to make an exception for you. Whether you stay or go after this is for you to decide.

text: Follow Phainon

speaker: Phainon
line: Sorry, I should've gotten here earlier. Please hear me out before you make up your mind.

text: Listen to what Phainon has to say
(Approach Phainon)

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I swear by the honor of the Chrysos Heirs here that your lives were never in danger. Before the interrogation started, Miss Castorice already sent a message to me, hoping that I would stop Aglaea.

speaker: Castorice
line: Only a select few can sway Lady Aglaea, and Lord Phainon is one of them.

text: But she didn't even apologize...
Phainon's a big deal, huh?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Oh, please stop.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea... She has long sealed her heart in ice, for Okhema's sake.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe this is the price of being a demigod? Standing among mortals, yet still so far from them.

text: Demigod?

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah... one more thing to explain. Let's not worry about that for now. You'll soon find out that Amphoreus's deepest secrets are all hidden here.

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, first, kindly look upward. What you see right now is the Astral Zodiac of the Vortex of Genesis, divided into twelve parts that record the Flame-Chase Journey of the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Phainon
line: The twelve vacant signs symbolize the twelve Titans of Amphoreus, while each illuminated constellation represents one Coreflame that mankind has restored to its rightful place.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There are... six restored Coreflames. You're already halfway through your journey?

speaker: Phainon
line: The generations before us paid a heavy price for that. The journey of the Chrysos Heirs once faced immense hurdles and made no progress for a very long time...

speaker: Phainon
line: It was Aglaea and Tribbie who rallied the Chrysos Heirs from all over the world once again, leading us to re-embark on this prophesized journey.

speaker: Castorice
line: And they are the only two demigods in the holy city.

text: Shouldn't it be the only four?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: While Tribbie, Trianne, and Trinnon are three individuals, I suppose they are considered one single divine essence.

text: So, what exactly is a demigod?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Worry not, I haven't forgotten about that.

speaker: Phainon
line: In the past, the Titans were the pillars of the world. Yet, the prophecy's revelation is that these twelve pillars must be shattered and the world's order reconstructed.

speaker: Phainon
line: But here's the problem: After the fall of the old gods, someone must hold up the broken pillars and fill the vacant seats until the coming of the Miracle of Genesis.

speaker: Phainon
line: Otherwise, the entire world will collapse before the prophecy comes true.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aglaea and Tribbie have already laid their own gods to rest, making them now both human and divine, as well as the bearers of Amphoreus's fate.

text: Sounds like quite a responsibility
Will you also become a demigod?
You mentioned persuing the Strife Titan...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So, that's what you meant by "your Coreflame."

speaker: Phainon
line: Bringing down the Titans, retrieving the Coreflames, and filling the vacant seats... This is the mission of the Chrysos Heirs, and I'm following in the footsteps of those two.

speaker: Castorice
line: Mission, huh...

speaker: Phainon
line: When it comes to the twelve Titans... no words can describe them more vividly than the whispers within the constellations.

speaker: Phainon
line: Why not step forward and listen to them for yourselves?

text: Listen to Lance of Fury's Voice of Constellation

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Listening to the voices of the constellations... Is that really possible?

text: (Talk to Phainon, optional)

speaker: Phainon
line: Move closer, listen carefully, and you may just catch the whispers echoing in the void.

speaker: Phainon
line: How about you start with the Lance of Fury, the voice of Nikador ?

text: (Talk to Castorice, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: Chrysos Heirs, demigods... Is what's written in the prophecy truly Amphoreus's only possible fate?

speaker: Castorice
line: Sorry, I was just thinking out loud... Please, step closer and listen to the voices of the Titans.

text: (Interact with the basin)
...The day is silent, and darkness has taken the stage...
...Flames rise higher, and drums fall like rain...
...Warriors soaked in golden blood, their cloaks tattered...
...Bronze shields you, and brass echoes my sorrow...
(After listening to the Voice of Constellation)

children.text: (UnlockAchievementGods and Mortals)

text: As the echoes of the constellations fall silent, the next sound to meet your ears is... waves?
â–¶ (Titan's murmurs)
The unfamiliar call carries a longing to take your soul's essence into the pool...
(Enter Tidal Bounty)

In the exploration of Amphoreus, Celestial Ambrosia can be obtained through various means, such as completing Trailblaze Missions, Adventure Missions, World Missions, opening treasures in the world, defeating Spirithieves Bartholos that occasionally appear, collecting Creation Nymphs, and solving the brainteasers of Verax Leo. In the exploration of Amphoreus, Celestial Ambrosia can be obtained through various means, such as completing Trailblaze Missions, Adventure Missions, World Missions, opening treasures in the world, defeating Spirithieves Bartholos that occasionally appear, collecting Creation Nymphs, and solving the brainteasers of Verax Leo. Dissolve the Celestial Ambrosia in water to raise the Offering Level and gain rewards. Dissolve the Celestial Ambrosia in water to raise the Offering Level and gain rewards.
(After offering theCelestial Ambrosia)
The water returns to its serene state... How curious â€” it appears that you just have to bring Celestial Ambrosia back here next time to get something nice.
Speak to Phainon about the voices of Titans you heard
(Talk to Phainon or Castorice)

speaker: Phainon
line: So, did you hear it?

text: I did...
I couldn't understand it...

speaker: Phainon
line: The first time I heard the voices of the Titans, I was just a boy playing with swords, oblivious to the meaning of life.

speaker: Phainon
line: To this day, I still don't know why the prophecy chose me, but I'm grateful for it... Without this journey, I might've already become a wandering soul on the battlefield.

speaker: Phainon
line: Alright, that's enough of my story. I want to extend a heartfelt invitation to you: join the Chrysos Heirs, and aid us in hunting down Nikador and retrieving the Coreflame from the Titan of Strife.

speaker: Phainon
line: If you still harbor doubts, I'll do my best to provide you with answers.

text: How are the Chrysos Heirs chosen?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...Unfortunately, the workings of the prophecy still remain a mystery to us all.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The only reliable speculation is that... it favors those caught in dire circumstances and bestows miracles upon them.

text: Where are the other Chrysos Heirs in the world?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Legend has it that the first Chrysos Heir was born millennia ago. Since then, the chosen ones began to walk this earth.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Then came the Chrysos War... A conflict backed by the gods, yet one that brought much bloodshed and claimed many heroes.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: By the time of my birth, the tales of the Chrysos Heirs had become more like legends than historical accounts. If there are others called forth by the prophecy... I trust that fate will guide them to us.

text: How do you plan to fight Nikador?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Armed with courage and unwavering resolve, our quest will begin as soon as Trianne locates Castrum Kremnos.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Without a doubt, it will be a momentous battle to the death... Prepare yourselves.

text: I've got it all figured out.

speaker: Phainon
line: The path ahead is bound to be perilous, and I won't impose my will upon you. Yet, if you choose to stay, I, Phainon from Aedes Elysiae, will spare no effort to bridge the gap between you and the Chrysos Heirs.

speaker: Castorice
line: Thawing the ice in Lady Aglaea's heart won't be easy...

speaker: Castorice
line: But I will do my best as well.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: â–¶ ...(Trailblazer), I'll leave the final decision to you.

text: You don't have any comments?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I trust Phainon, but I trust your judgment more.

text: You're letting me make the decision? Seriously?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I trust your judgment more on matters like this.

text: Stay on Amphoreus.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That's wonderful to hear. You truly are the hope of Amphoreus.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I've always believed that the journey of the Chrysos Heirs is not meant to be the saga of a select few, and that we must unite all potential allies, especially heroic figures like you.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Once we triumph in the battle against Nikador ... that should dispel Aglaea's doubts.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Lord Phainon... Our guests seem quite weary. Should we have them return to the bath chamber for some rest?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Ah, my apologies. I got a bit carried away. It's been a long first day for you here on Amphoreus.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: To leave the Vortex, simply repeat the same ritual in front of the spirit basin.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Be sure to rest well in the bath chamber. I trust that Trianne will have returned with news about Castrum Kremnos by the time the two of you are fully recharged.

text: Leave Amphoreus.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: So... you'll end things here? Are you sure about that?

children.text: Just kidding. We have to press on in our trailblazing expedition.
(Same dialogue as above)
I'm tired. I just want to go.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...I understand. Now that I think back on it, you both have selflessly helped Okhema, while we have met your good will with doubt and intimidation. It's indeed not fair.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You showed empathy toward my struggle earlier, and now it's my turn to return that kindness.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The journey of the Chrysos Heirs... truly is a lonely one.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: â–¶ Let's go, Dan Heng, (Trailblazer). I'll escort you back to where you landed.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I know that a reunion in the future is wishful thinking, but at the very least, we can bid each other a proper farewell.

children.text: Escorted by Phainon and the holy city guards, you and Dan Heng return to the crash site in the Abyss. Together, you salvage the Express' coach car.
With the assistance of an Okhema citizen resembling an Intellitron , you depart Amphoreus without suffering the so-called "curse from beyond the sky."
After returning to the Astral Express, you discover Black Swan has already left without telling anyone. March 7th 's condition has gotten worse, but no one seems to know what the cause is.
Despite a fuel shortage, you complete a final warp jump, putting your hopes in the next location and how it might resolve all your worries.
As for the fate of Amphoreus, the Eternal Land, and the dramatic changes it will bring to the Cosmos... It has nothing to do with you, at least in your lifetime.
(Credits roll)

Amphoreus, The Eternal Land The End Honkai: Star Rail Lead Actors (Trailblazer) Starring Dan Heng as Dan Heng Phainon asÂ ?? Castorice as Castorice? Tribios as Tribbie, Trinnon, Trianne Â ?? Â ?? Â ??... Aglaea as Aglaea Mydeimos as Mydei ?? asÂ ?? Nikador as Nikador May This Journey Lead Us Starward

(Return to the starting screen)
(Return to before speaking with Phainon, with the option removed)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Well, that was a lot of drama for one day.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's go. With Phainon's guarantee, we can at least take a moment to rest without any worries.

text: I kind of feel like we might've forgotten something...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Oh... We need to take a photo for March. Good thing you still remembered that.

text: We've got to take a photo of this place for March 7th.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...I almost forgot. Good thing you still remembered that.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's capture the spectacle of the Vortex of Genesis.

text: Take a photo of the wondrous sight of the Vortex of Genesis

title: Step Description
content: After understanding from Phainon the Chrysos Heirs' arduous journey to save the world, we ultimately decided to remain in Amphoreus. After a period of rest and recovery, the Chrysos Heirs reconvened, readying themselves for an attack against Castrum Kremnos, where Nikador was, with the goal of seizing the Coreflame of the Lance of Fury.

text: (Talk to Phainon, optional)

speaker: Phainon
line: Be sure to rest well in the bath chamber. I trust that Trianne will have returned with news about Castrum Kremnos by the time the two of you are fully recharged.

text: (Talk to Castorice, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm sorry. I hope... you can forgive me for my actions earlier.

speaker: Castorice
line: I had to follow Lady Aglaea's instructions to avoid arousing her suspicion.

text: Why did she choose you to be the executioner?
I don't blame you.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...But I should not come near you.

speaker: Castorice
line: Because I... am the shadow of "death."

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm sorry, but I prefer not to delve into such a heavy topic at the moment. Please follow Lord Phainon's suggestion and return to the bath chamber for some rest.

speaker: Castorice
line: If you're interested in hearing more of the world's voices, feel free to prolong your stay in the Vortex.

text: (Start Taking Photo)
The totems of the Twelve Titans stand like twelve pairs of watchful, imperious eyes, overseeing the world they forged, nurtured, and ultimately brought to ruin.
When the twelve constellations align and shine, the "miracle" that the Chrysos Heirs speak of will illuminate â€” or so their prophecies claim.
Leave the Vortex of Genesis and return to the private bath chamber
(After taking the photo)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Alright... All the constellations of the twelve Titans are in there. Time to head out.

text: (Teleport back toHall of Respite)

children.text: (Unlock AchievementI Like to Tie People in My Dream)

text: Calm your mood and rest up
(Interact with the chair)
Rest for one night

speaker: Dan Heng
line: So much has happened today.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What? Do I have something on my face?

text: Today, you talked...
...more than you did in the entire three worlds before this.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Well, since the talkative one isn't around, someone else has to take her place.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But it's been a long day for me too, so let's get through the review quickly.

text: Agreed!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: By estimation, it took us about twenty system hours to figure out the current conditions on Amphoreus and build connections with the locals â€” a pretty good start.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But I feel that there's more to everything than meets the eye... Even the Chrysos Heirs themselves aren't as unified as we imagined.

text: Is it too late to bail out now?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Don't take Aglaea's words to heart right now. Her verbal attack on us was quite sudden. There might be a reason behind it.

text: We're still looking at things through a clouded lens.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Aglaea's verbal attack on us was also quite sudden. There might be a reason behind it.

text: Wasn't expecting Aglaea to be that ruthless...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Her verbal attack on us seemed quite sudden. There might be a reason behind it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: With all these doubts in our minds, we can only just do our best.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There's no "right" answer to the Trailblaze, after all. All we can do is dive into this world and take things one step at a time.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Plenty of questions are still up in the air, but my brain is too tired to handle them... Phainon's right â€” let's call it a day and save them for tomorrow.

text: In the meantime...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Agy, this campaign is going to turn out fine, right?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Do not harbor doubt, teacher. As the interpreter of the prophecy for the Chrysos Heirs, any uncertainty in your words may undermine people's resolve.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Alright, alright, but it's just you and us here...

speaker: Tribbie
line: â–¶ By the way... Agy, I was actually wondering, when you were in the Vortex earlier with Dan Heng and (Trailblazer), were you actually going to...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Certainly not.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Phew... That's good to know.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Why even bother to ask? If you were truly convinced of my intent to harm them, you would have intervened.

speaker: Tribbie
line: You sure don't miss a thing. We are just curious... What is really going through your head, Agy?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Initially, my plan was to use the threat of "banishment" to test their resolve and perseverance.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But I noticed a sense of unease in Castorice. She trusted in them and even reached out to Phainon in secret, believing I was unaware...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Therefore, I took advantage of the situation and changed the threat from "banishment" to "execution," to see if the two could remain firm under the most extreme pressure.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Simultaneously, it might also strengthen their bonds with Phainon and Castorice.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Do you have to go to such lengths for the battle against Nikador ?

speaker: Tribbie
line: That's going to make it a lot tougher for you to gain their trust...

speaker: Aglaea
line: That's not important.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You and I will eventually step off the stage and leave Amphoreus's fate in the hands of others... That's the future you foresee, isn't it?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Yeah.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The prophecy of deliverance is nothing if not ambiguous. It urges us to defy the gods yet refrains from providing a clear glimpse of what lies ahead.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Right now, it is people's faith in the prophecy that unites them around the Chrysos Heirs. Should a time come when their faith is shaken... all will crumble.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Hence, we must be prepared. When our task is to craft the armor for the Deliverer, what harm is there if you and I don humble attire?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy... Have you noticed...

speaker: Tribbie
line: You keep saying that you don't believe in humanity's altruism, but your actions are a counterexample.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Perhaps it's because my "humanity" is distancing itself from me.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Another never-ending dawn. How bright is the day, and how long is the night.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The golden thread hangs unusually silent today, as if the heavens, earth, and ocean are all holding their breath. Could they be mourning the impending downfall of a Titan...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Unwinding in a bath sounds appealing now... Would you care to join me?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Let's go, Agy. When have we ever been able to say no in all these hundreds of years?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ Mmm... What's that sound?

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Night Stars, Accompany My Slumber.mp4

line: ...Sound? Who? That? Which?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ Who's talking...
...Calm down. Calm down. This time. Next time?

text: Tell me who you are.

children.line: ...Who? Who is? You... I... Who am I?

text: Is that you, Stellaron ?

children.line: ...Ron? Stella? Who? You... I... Who am I?

text: Oh, shut it! Someone's trying to sleep here!

children.line: ...Sleep? Here? There? You... I... Who am I?

line: ...Broken. Lost. Want... complete.
...Sleep. Go sleep. Disturb... should not.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ (Am I... dreaming?)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ (Feels like there's been a voice talking in my head all night...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: â–¶ (I should probably mention this to Dan Heng.)

text: Tell Dan Heng about the voice you heard in your dream
(Talk to Dan Heng)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You're finally awake. About time.

text: I slept in pretty late. It's so bright outside!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Did you already forget? The sky has been this bright since we arrived at the holy city.

text: Have you been up for a while?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Yeah, I wake up easily when it's too bright outside... The sky has been like this since we arrived at the holy city.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Did you sleep well?

text: There was this voice in my dream...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: A voice? The Voice of the Stellaron again or...

text: It sounded like an animal, but somehow, I could understand it.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That sounds a bit contradictory.

text: I couldn't really make it out. It was like it was speaking in riddles.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: In a way, chaos is the nature of dreams.

text: It was... pretty cute, unlike the Stellaron.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: So, it wasn't a nightmare. But be careful, that might be its means of luring you in.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Keep a note of whatever you can remember. This strange dream might be connected to the rules of this world.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: While you were asleep, I did some thinking. I believe the most pressing concern is still how the people of Amphoreus view what's beyond the sky. Unfortunately, contacting the Express might not be feasible for a while.

text: If we try to fly out of Amphoreus...
...Will we also incur the wrath of the gods?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Yes. In the worst case, the entrance to Amphoreus is a one-way door, letting people in but not out.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hm? There's a new message.

text: (Receive a message fromAmphoreus Welcome Team)

Messages Amphoreus Welcome Team Phainon Did you both get a good rest? Fully recharged! (Trailblazer) I'm ready to tackle something big! Phainon Nice. You're all fired up Dan Heng The room conditions are great, and it's comfortable to rest here. Is there something you want to discuss with us? The rest wasn't great... (Trailblazer) Didn't sleep too well Phainon That's not good. Is there an issue with the bath's atmosphere? Dan Heng The room's perfect. I just pushed myself too hard yesterday. Anything you want to discuss? Oh, it's you... (Trailblazer) Oh, it's you â€” I was expecting someone else. Phainon Who were you expecting? Did someone beat me here? Dan Heng Nothing. Do you need anything from us? Phainon I've got some good news! Teacher Trianne has located Castrum Kremnos. Hurry to the Chrysos Heirs' Bath in the Marmoreal Palace, and let's get ready to take on Nikador! Ah, you can rest for a bit longer. No rush Take it easy
Go to the Chrysos Heirs baths and meet with everyone

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I wasn't expecting the expedition to set off after only a night of rest.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's set the questions aside for now. The Chrysos Heirs are getting ready to mobilize.

text: (Approach Phainon)

speaker: Phainon
line: Great to see you here!

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph... Entrusting our fates to two strangers, is this madness or folly?

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe both. You should really make more friends, Mydei.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Heroes, your attention please.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Trianne has returned with news: For the first time in many years, we have dispersed the fog around Castrum Kremnos and verified its location.

speaker: Aglaea
line: The awaited moment has finally arrived for the Chrysos Heirs. Our path forward is now clear: Vanquish Nikador , the violent Lance of Fury, and bring the Coreflame of Strife back to Okhema to fuel the prophesized miracle.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is an arduous mission, and I must heed the voices of all to determine the best candidates for this campaign.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Should you harbor any thoughts, this is the moment to bring them forth.

speaker: Phainon
line: I, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae, wish to join the crusade against Nikador .

speaker: Phainon
line: Furthermore, I recommend the two warriors from foreign lands. They have fought alongside me against Nikador 's double, and I have full faith in their bravery.

text: That sounds really dangerous. Is it too late to back out?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Lounging in a bath chamber isn't exactly trailblazing.

text: Guess we have no choice but to give it our all.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Are you still not used to it? This is the destiny of a Trailblazer.

speaker: Mydei
line: I, Mydei from Castrum Kremnos, volunteer to join.

speaker: Mydei
line: Nikador has become corrupted over the years, his pride waning, but his might endures. Victory only lies in assembling a full-fledged army.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I'm willing to join as well, to help guide departing souls and ease everyone's burdens...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I concur with your opinion. Though his divinity has faded, Nikador remains a formidable adversary.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Yet, I cannot jeopardize all of your lives in one single battle.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As we speak, the Hand of Shadow remains missing, the Eye of Twilight is still coveting our land, and Cerces and Oronyx present significant threats, despite their lack of overt hostility toward humanity.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Even with two demigods protecting the holy city, the risk is too great. Hence...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Castorice, you must remain here. Your place is not on the front lines, and the battlefield is best left to the warriors.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I understand.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As for the two foreign warriors... Select one to accompany you, Phainon. Placing both esteemed guests on the front line would not be proper.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ (Trailblazer) excels in wielding a range of weapons, and ( his / her ) flaming lance has quelled the enemy's advances multiple times. Mydei and I are both better at offense, so from a tactical standpoint...

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ (Trailblazer), would you be willing to fight alongside us?

text: Sure, let's do this!
I might not be tanky enough, though.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: With those two, the battle should end quickly.

text: We could try letting Dan Heng tank...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: What are you talking about? Now's not the time for jokes.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ If (Trailblazer) has no objections... Aglaea, the three of us will take on the mission to hunt down the Titan.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Mydeimos, Castrum Kremnos was your home. Your people were once Nikador's followers, yet you've chosen to turn to Okhema and dedicate yourself to the prophecy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Do you swear upon Kephale 's body to make this mission of the Chrysos Heirs your foremost duty?

speaker: Mydei
line: When Nikador succumbed to madness, they stopped being a god to my people.

speaker: Mydei
line: I will use my wrath as a human to strip that god of their authority. As for the Coreflame and that soon-to-be-vacant divine throne...

speaker: Mydei
line: If that is the object you desire, you can have it. I have no interest in becoming a replacement god.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hah! How generous, but I'm not the type to accept charity, so I'll definitely be the one who deals the final blow through Nikador 's heart.

speaker: Aglaea
line: â–¶ The party that will embark on the expedition to Castrum Kremnos is decided: Phainon from Aedes Elysiae, Mydei from Castrum Kremnos, and... (Trailblazer) from the outlands.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I â€” Aglaea from Okhema, Chrysos Heir and the demigod who bears Mnestia 's divine authority â€” hereby bless your journey ahead.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Trianne will open the gate that will lead you to Castrum Kremnos. May the golden thread guide you on your journey and bring you safely home.

text: Speak with Trianne and get ready to go to Castrum Kremnos
(Talk to Aglaea, optional)

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is by the will of the gods that you stood on Okhema's side in the end.

text: I thought you didn't trust me.
No thanks to you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are Phainon and Mydei's companion. So long as they're willing to entrust you with their lives, my trust in you doesn't matter.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Go. Stand with the two Chrysos Heirs. Okhema has need of a true god of war. It's time for the mad god Nikador's reign to end.

text: (Talk to Castorice, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: Please, come back victorious.

speaker: Castorice
line: I'll pray for you. May your steps be ever quicker than death's relentless pursuit.

text: (Talk to Dan Heng, optional)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I plan to stay here for a while and learn more about Amphoreus from Lady Tribbie. You'll handle the action, and I'll deal with the research. We each have a role to play.

text: Shall we have a goodbye hug?
Dan Heng refuses your proposal with silence.
(Talk to Trianne)

speaker: Trianne
line: Blow, wind, blow~! All the way to Castrum Kremnos!

speaker: Trianne
line: Woohoo! Snowy, De, let's fly together! All the way across!

speaker: Phainon
line: We don't have wings on our backs, Trianne. Can you open a gate for us?

speaker: Trianne
line: Oh... A gate. How boring. Alright, let's open a gate! Century Gate! Woo!!

text: Why does she act like a child?
Oh, it's not an actual gate?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hahaha, were you expecting actual city gates?

speaker: Phainon
line: It's true Trianne is very playful, but she's the best gatekeeper in Amphoreus. Her Century Gate never fails.

text: There's a chance of failure?
...Is there another way to travel?

speaker: Mydei
line: Instead of worrying about gates, why don't you take the time to think about how the three of us are supposed to fend off an entire army.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's not like you at all, Mydei. Don't tell me you're scared?

speaker: Trianne
line: Alright! Century Gate... is opening... soon! Right now!

speaker: Trianne
line: Snowy, De, and newbie Little Gray, are you all ready?

text: Let's go slay a god!

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Slay, slay!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: â–¶ (Trailblazer), take this with you.

children.text: Dan Heng gives March 7th's camera to you...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Record the sights you see on your adventure for March.

children.text: Wait for my triumphant return!
I'll capture all the decisive moments!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Keep yourself safe, and work within your capabilities.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Ahem! Stand still and listen up!

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: We â€” Tribbie, Trianne, and Trinnon from Janusopolis, messengers of the Chrysos Heirs and the demigods who bear Janus 's divine authority â€” give unto you our blessings!

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: May fate show you benevolence and seal away all paths that lead to dead ends...

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: And throw open all gates that lead to victory!

text: I still need a moment to mentally prepare...

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Get ready! Get ready! I don't wanna wait! Slowpoke!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I'm sorry, Trianne. This is a matter of grave importance, so please bear with us.
